Indonesia - Community-Based Settlement,
            Rehabilitation, and reconstruction of Nanggroe Aceh
            Darussalam and Nias Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Community-Based Settlement,
            Reconstruction, and Rehabilitation for Nanggroe Aceh
            Darussalam and Nias Project will support the
            Government's efforts in restoring the living conditions
            of the communities affected by the earthquake and tsunami
            that struck the project area on December 2004. It will
            contribute to the Government's grant program for
            settlement, rehabilitation, and reconstruction, and, provide
            institutional support to the relevant, lead agency in
            reconstruction of Nanggroe Aceh Darussalam and Nias. Though
            its components, the project will: 1) provide shelter,
            repair, and reconstruction grants to control the
            construction process, managed through a community-based
            approach; rebuild homes by affected people themselves,
            seeking to remain in their own land, receiving the full
            amount of support they are eligible for. Housing
            facilitators will be recruited to work, and assist
            communities in these steps. Additionally, this component
            includes a window of funds for shelter grants. 2) finance
            block grants for priority infrastructure for the
            rehabilitation of small-scale priority infrastructure. This
            component builds upon, and complements existing
            infrastructure grant support provided for community level
            infrastructure rehabilitation. Block grants under this
            component match with block grants provided through other
            operations for a full minimum basic infrastructure, and
            social service needs. 3) finance a series of immediate and
            medium-term technical assistance (TA) activities for the
            establishment and implementation of the shelter support
            grants, and priority infrastructure block grant schemes,
            and, financial management systems. Moreover, the component
            will support overall project implementation at the
            provincial, district, and village levels, while capacity
            building at the community level will be pursued, to maintain
            and manage project activities. 4) finance the technical
            assistance consultants, providing support to the Settlement
            Reconstruction and Rehabilitation Strategy Program for Aceh
            and Nias, as well as the cost of the establishment, and
            execution of public communications, complaint handling, and,
            an internal and external monitoring and evaluation
            framework, to maximize effectiveness, accountability, and
            transparency. The component also will support a Project
            Management Information System (MIS), and further facilitate
            good governance procedures.
